item.description:
August 18th to the 19th (rain or shine) - this will be an easy-to-moderate 4-mile hike. Destination is Sage's Ravine on the Appalachain Trail in the Northwest corner of CT (there is a possibility of a more difficult climb (not technical) to the top of Bear Mountain, which could be a separate hike for those who want more challenge, but that will be a game-time decision and needn't include everybody, if some choose not to). The hike will take 3-4 hours from the trailhead to the campsite.


The campsite is not a traditional "car-camping" sort of comfort. Folks who want to do this will be using an outhouse and setting up camp in the woods. If there is a campfire, campers would create the pit. We need to be sure to pack out any trash we create. This is not for experienced hikers only, but it could be classified as "roughing it" and will challenge those who have never backpacked.


Supplies should include:


- Backpack (doesn't need to be fancy, but should be comfortable and accomodate the
essentials listed below)
- Sleeping bag (and pad, if desired)
- Tent (and willingness to share, if needed)
- Flashlight
- Comfy Hiking shoes
- Food and snacks for a day and a half
- Water/Fluids for 2 days
- Some First Aid provisions
- Bug spray
- Toilet Paper
- Rain gear (in the event of inclement weather)


It would be a good idea to try to water proof your gear by throwing sleeping bags into a trash bag then bringing a spare bag to put over your pack.


A small water filter and camp stove will be brought along, but you should bring food that you can prepare on your own with use of this equipment if necessary - there are no camp "Cookies".


Carpooling might be necessary, depending on interest - the rendevous point would be the Starbucks Parking lot in Woodbridge (on Rt. 69, just past the underpass of the Merrit Pkwy). We should meet at 11:00 am on Saturday (8/18).


Steve (resident outdoorsman) is the contact for this event:
203.954.9362
item.name: Sat. 8/18 & Sun. 8/19 - Overnight Backpacking Trip to Sage's Ravine on the AT
